title: Classic St. Louis Railroading/Santa Fe Vintage Diesels
description:
*******************************************************************************
               Classic St. Louis Railroading/Santa Fe Vintage Diesels
*******************************************************************************

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                              General Information
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Type.................: Video  
More Info............: http://www.pentrex.com/ffs14dvd.html

Video Format.........: XviD
Video Bitrate........: 895, 851
Resolution...........: 432x320
Format...............: Color
FPS..................: 23.976
Source...............: DVD   
Original Format......: NTSC


Runtime..............: 98 min. (total)
Language.............: English

Here are two shows presenting more of your favorite Fallen Flags. These 
programs were filmed by noted railroad photographer Dick Wallin during the 
1960s and 1970s. Each program brings you a unique look at classic motive power 
on AmericaÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â s historic railroads!



************Classic St. Louis Railroading (48 minutes)*************

Experience eighteen different railroads in and around St. Louis. Featured are: 
Alton & Southern * Chicago & Eastern Illinois * Chicago & North Western * 
Chicago, Burlington & Quincy * Cotton Belt * Frisco * Gulf, Mobile & Ohio * 
Illinois Central * Louisville & Nashville * Manufacturer&#039;s Railway * 
Missouri-Kansas-Texas * Missouri Pacific * New York Central * Norfolk & Western 
(including locomotives still painted in Wabash and in Nickel Plate colors) * 
Penn Central * Pennsylvania * Terminal Railroad Association * early Amtrak.

Motive power and paint schemes include EMD E-and F-units, Geeps, SW1200s and 
SW1500s, SD40s and SD45s, and a rare TR1 cow/calf set; Alco RS2, RS3, RSD5, RS36,
S2, FA, and C424; GE U25B, U30B, and U30C; and an F-M H10-44. Shot at sites in 
Illinois and Missouri, it&#039;s a fantastic journey back to the heart of American 
railroading!



*************Santa Fe Vintage Diesels (50 minutes)******************

Fairbanks-Morse, Baldwin, Alco, and EMD locomotives in passenger and freight 
service fill the screen in this exciting retrospective of Santa Fe motive power 
in New Mexico, Kansas, and Illinois. You&#039;ll see Alco U30CGs, U28CGs and 
Fairbanks-Morse H12-44Ts at Dearborn Station in Chicago, the EMD GP7M prototype 
used on the Santa Fe as #99, the popular CF7s rebuilt from F3s and F7s by the 
Santa Fe in their own shops, and a rare shot of an early articulated railcar. 
Line drawings and specifications make this a valuable resource for your 
railroad collection!
